definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]

sentences.english: These include your favourites and pages you’ve visited recently.
sentences.chinese: 其中包括你收藏夾裏面的地址和你最近訪問過的網頁。

sentences.english: Add the code to Favorites and you can click it to run directly.
sentences.chinese: 把以上代碼加入收藏夾後直接點擊使用即可。

sentences.english: At the time Work is busy, I first joined the favorites.
sentences.chinese: 當時工作正忙，我就先加入收藏夾了。

sentences.english: The more people add it as a favorite, the higher it will be ranked.
sentences.chinese: 越多的人將其添加到收藏夾，它的排名就會越高。

sentences.english: Reviews can also be sent to friends, or added to your favorites.
sentences.chinese: 評論也可以發送給朋友，或者添加到你的收藏夾中去。

sentences.english: People can't bookmark individual pages of your site.
sentences.chinese: 人們不會把你站點的單獨一個頁面加入收藏夾。

sentences.english: I have a hunch you'll find at least one or two you want to bookmark.
sentences.chinese: 我想你至少能找到一兩個喜歡的加入收藏夾。

sentences.english: The icon is a star. It is a collection folder to save your favorite websites.
sentences.chinese: 圖標爲五角星，是收藏夾，存放你喜歡的網址。

sentences.english: My favorite link is the folder and computer.
sentences.chinese: 我的收藏夾鏈接是文件夾和計算機。

definition: La Comédie humaine, series of novels by 19th century French novelist Honoré de Balzac 巴爾扎克|巴尔扎克[Ba1 er3 zha1 ke4]
hardware-only device/computer without operating system or other software installed/mobile phone or pager without network subscription
Cain (name)/Cain (biblical character), a figure of Judeo-Christian-Muslim mythology
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
